description: Grafana internal metrics from Prometheus scraping — HTTP performance, alerting, authentication, database connections, and Go runtime.

panels.description: Grafana API request rate broken down by HTTP status code. Shows the throughput of the Grafana REST API.
panels.title: API Requests/sec by Status

panels.description: Grafana page response rate by HTTP status code. Covers full page loads served by Grafana.
panels.title: Page Requests/sec by Status

panels.description: Datasource proxy request rate by HTTP status code. Shows traffic proxied through Grafana to backend datasources.
panels.title: Proxy Requests/sec by Status

panels.description: Dashboard search API latency by quantile. Shows p50, p90, p99 response times for dashboard search operations.
panels.title: Dashboard Search Latency by Quantile

panels.description: Grafana API server request rate. Includes internal API server requests for unified storage and resource APIs.
panels.title: API Server Requests/sec by Status

panels.description: Number of alert rules in each state over time. Monitors the health of the Grafana alerting system.
panels.title: Alerts by State

panels.description: Number of silences in each state. Silences suppress alert notifications.
panels.title: Silences by State

panels.description: Authentication attempt rate by result (success/failure). Spikes in failures may indicate brute-force attacks or misconfigured clients.
panels.title: Auth Attempts/sec by Result

panels.description: RBAC authorization attempt rate. Shows how often Grafana evaluates permissions for API requests.
panels.title: Authorization Attempts/sec

panels.description: Total open database connections per database. Grafana uses multiple SQLite/PostgreSQL databases internally.
panels.title: Open Connections by Database

panels.description: Database connections actively executing queries per database.
panels.title: In-Use Connections by Database

panels.description: Idle database connections in the pool per database. These are ready to serve new queries without connection setup overhead.
panels.title: Idle Connections by Database

panels.description: Go garbage collection pause duration by quantile. High GC pauses can cause request latency spikes.
panels.title: GC Pause Duration by Quantile

panels.description: Rate of database connections being closed due to max idle count limits. High churn may indicate connection pool is undersized.
panels.title: Connection Closures/sec (Max Idle)

panels.description: Number of active WebSocket/live client connections to Grafana. Reflects real-time dashboard usage.
panels.title: Live Client Connections

panels.description: Rate of messages sent and received through the Grafana Live transport layer (WebSocket).
panels.title: Live Transport Messages/sec

title: GF-01 Grafana Metrics
